title: Job Openings at Tribest Corporate Support Limited
content:
Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Direct Sales Executive

Job Location: Nigeria 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Customer Acquisition: Actively seek out new sales opportunities through networking, social media, and cold calling.
	Product Presentation: Clearly explain the features and benefits of the company’s products or services (e.g., bank accounts, loans, or outsourcing solutions) to potential clients.
	Target Achievement: Consistently meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales quotas as defined by management.
	Relationship Management: Maintain rapport with new customers to ensure a smooth onboarding process and encourage referrals.
	Market Feedback: Collect and share insights from the field regarding competitor activities and customer pain points to help improve service offerings.
	Reporting: Maintain accurate records of all sales activities and provide regular updates via the CRM or sales logs.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree with 1 - 3 years of experience.


Salary
N93,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 23rd February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Archive Officer

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Duration of Contract: 1 Month

Requirements


	Qualification: NCE, OND
	Must reside at Apapa or close to Apapa
	Age 30 years and below.


Salary
N150,000 monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 29th January, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Accounts Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Accounts Officer is responsible for managing all financial records and transactions within the organization.
	This role involves a wide range of duties, from accounts payable and receivable to bank reconciliations and financial reporting.
	The ideal candidate will be a meticulous and highly organized professional with a strong understanding of accounting principles and a commitment to accuracy.


Key Responsibilities


	Financial Record Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, including ledgers, journals, and balance sheets.
	Accounts Payable/Receivable: Process and reconcile invoices, manage payments to vendors, and follow up on outstanding client payments.
	Bank Reconciliation: Conduct regular bank reconciliations to ensure accuracy and identify any discrepancies.
	Financial Reporting: Prepare periodic financial reports, including profit and loss statements and cash flow reports.
	Budgeting and Forecasting: Assist in the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts.
	Compliance: Ensure all financial transactions and records comply with company policies and relevant financial regulations.


Qualifications and Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Proven experience as an Accounts Officer or in a similar finance-related role.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong analytical skills and exceptional attention to detail.
	Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 17th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

4.) Call Centre Representative

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Call Centre Representative will serve as the first point of contact for customers, handling inquiries, complaints, and service requests with professionalism and efficiency.
	This role requires excellent communication skills and a deep understanding of customer service principles to ensure a positive experience for every caller.


Key Responsibilities
Customer Interaction:


	Handle a high volume of inbound and outbound calls in a timely manner.
	Answer customer questions, provide information, and resolve issues with a focus on first-call resolution.
	Escalate complex problems to the appropriate department or team lead when necessary.
	Maintain a polite, empathetic, and professional tone at all times.


Data Management and Reporting:


	Accurately document all customer interactions, including details of inquiries, comments, and complaints.
	Update customer information and records in the company database.
	Generate and submit daily or weekly reports on call volume, service issues, and customer feedback.


Product and Service Knowledge:


	Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the company's products, services, and policies.
	Continuously update knowledge to stay informed of any changes or new offerings.
	Proactively identify customer needs and suggest appropriate products or services.


Qualifications and Requirements


	A minimum of a Higher National Diploma or its equivalent is required.
	Proven experience in a call centre or a customer service role is highly preferred.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and a customer-centric mindset.
	Proficiency in using call centre software and CRM systems.
	Ability to multitask and perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N200,000 / month

Application Closing Date: 5th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

  "description": "African Reinsurance Corporation (Africa Re) is a leading African Reinsurance Company, with its Headquarters in Lagos, Nigeria. Africa Re has six Regional Offices which includes: Casablanca (Morocco), Abidjan (C&ocirc;te d&#39;Ivoire), Nairobi (Kenya), Lagos (Nigeria), Cairo (Egypt) and Ebene (Mauritius).

The Corporation additionally, has one (1) Local Office in Addis Ababa (Ethiopia), two Underwriting Representative Offices in Kampala (Uganda) and Kinshasa (DRC) as well as three (3) Subsidiaries (Africa Re South Africa Limited in Johannesburg (South Africa), Africa Retakaful in Cairo (Egypt) and Africa Re Underwriting Agency Limited in Dubai (The United Arab Emirates).

Africa Re has a broad-based shareholding comprising 42 African member states, the African Development Bank (AFDB), 112 African insurance and reinsurance companies and three (3) non-regional shareholders including leading global Insurers and Reinsurers.
&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Property Management Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Department:&nbsp;General Services

Description


	The African Reinsurance Corporation holds residential and commercial real estate properties within its investment portfolios or corporate assets, which are managed on day-to-day operations by third-party property management service providers responsible for leasing, maintenance, and tenant relations.
	The Property Management Officer will work alongside third-party property management service providers to oversee corporate-owned properties.
	The successful candidate will concentrate on administrative oversight, compliance, and coordination, while the day-to-day operations are entirely managed by third-party providers.
	His collaboration with external property management service providers should ensure efficiency, cost control, and alignment with corporate goals.
	The Property Management Officer will be responsible for generating report on the financial performance and overall management of a portfolio of rental properties.
	This includes the Lagos Head Office building, the Abuja New Head Office building, Lagos Commercial Residential Apartments, and Executive Management residences, etc.
	The primary duty is to monitor, document, and maintain records of property transactions, report on profitability, and ensure tenant satisfaction, legal compliance, and the preservation of the asset&#39;s value.
	Additionally, will be accountable for carrying out any tasks that may be assigned to him/her at any time.


Responsibilities
Under the supervision of the Senior Manager of Engineering and General Services, along with the leadership of the Director of General Services, the in-house Property Management Officer will perform the following core functions:
Communication and Coordination:


	Property Oversight - Coordinating with third-party property management service providers and production centers to monitor performance of investments property and aligning activities with corporate objectives.
	Serve as primary liaison &mdash; Act as the central hub for all communications between the Corporation and third-party providers, ensuring timely responses to inquiries, updates, and escalations. This includes scheduling regular meetings, disseminating information, and resolving miscommunications.
	Facilitate information flow &mdash; Relay internal directives (e.g., policy changes or strategic priorities) to external third-party managers and consolidate feedback or issues from providers back to internal stakeholders and departmental team level.


Reporting and Analytics:


	Review and compile reports &mdash; Analyze monthly/quarterly reports from third-party providers on metrics like occupancy rates, rental income, maintenance logs, and tenant satisfaction. Prepare summarized versions for internal review, highlighting variances or trends.
	Performance monitoring &mdash; Track key performance indicators (KPIs) of third-party providers against service level agreements (SLAs), identifying areas for improvement and recommending actions.


Financial and Budget Management:


	Budget oversight &mdash; Assist in preparing and monitoring property budgets, reviewing expense reports from external third-party providers, and approving or questioning expenditures to ensure cost efficiency.
	Service Charges - Coordinate with third-party property managers to carry out the monthly apportionments of all utility bills and communicate the details to tenants in the Head office properties.
	Invoice and payment processing &mdash; Verify invoices from third-party services providers (professional fees, etc.), coordinate with accounts payable for timely payments, and reconcile financial statements to prevent discrepancies.
	Property Valuations &amp; Fixed Asset Inventory &mdash; Ensure the fixed asset inventory and the valuation of the corporate-owned property are carried out periodically, in alignment with the relevant corporate policies and procedures.


Tenants Contracts and Compliance Management:


	Contracts administration &mdash; Manage tenants contracts with third-party providers, including KYC process, renewals, amendments, and terminations. Ensure all terms are adhered to and negotiate adjustments as needed.
	Regulatory compliance &mdash; Oversee adherence to local, state, and federal regulations (e.g., tenancy and housing laws, environmental standards). Coordinate audits, inspections, and documentation to mitigate risks.
	Risk and insurance coordination &mdash; Review insurance policies for properties, handle claims processing with providers, and ensure adequate coverage.


Operational Support:


	Vendors and subcontractors&rsquo; coordination &mdash; If third-party property managers engage subcontractors (e.g., for repairs or landscaping), the Property Management Officer reviews selections, monitors performance, and ensures alignment with the Corporation&rsquo;s standards.
	Data and record management &mdash; Maintain centralized databases or systems for property records, leases, tenants information, and historical data. Ensure data accuracy and accessibility for internal teams.
	Issue resolution and escalation &mdash; Administratively handle escalated issues from third-party property service providers, such as major repairs or tenant disputes, by coordinating resources and documenting resolutions.


Strategic and Improvement Functions:


	Process optimization &mdash; Identify inefficiencies in coordination processes and recommend improvements, such as implementing new software tools for reporting or communication.
	Visits and Inspection of property &mdash; Regularly monitor and visit the corporate-owned properties to assess the quality of maintenance performed by the facility management team and report any property damage and inefficiencies observed.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Real Estate/Facilities Management, Business Administration or Relevant Engineering Degrees (e.g. Electrical or Mechanical) with relevant experiences in Real Estate Management.
	Minimum of seven (6) years of relevant work experience is required
	Relevant professional qualifications will be desirable
	Hands-on experience with corporate-owned commercial/office properties is highly valued.
	Real estate-related and Engineering professional certifications (valuable for demonstrating competence, especially from recognized bodies) like Certified Property Manager (CPM), Certified International Property Specialist (CIPS), Certified Commercial Investment Member (CCIM), Certified Energy Manager (CEM), Certified Electrical Safety Compliance Professional (CESCP), Certified Power Quality Professional, Certified Reliability Engineer (CRE), LEED Accredited Professional (AP) or Project Management Professional (PMP) will be an added advantage.


Additional Requirements:
Applicants must also be:


	Able to communicate effectively (written and oral) in English Language.
	Working knowledge of French will be an added advantage.


Competencies:
Professionalism (Essential soft and Business skills)


	Good knowledge of Real Estate and Facilities Management
	Operations and Maintenance Knowledge &mdash; Understanding building systems, preventive maintenance, work order management, and ensuring properties meet safety, regulatory, and compliance standards (e.g., safety regulations, insurance requirements for vendors).
	Project Coordination &mdash; Planning, scheduling, and overseeing projects (e.g., repairs, renovations, installations) involving multiple vendors.
	Real Estate and Property Fundamentals &mdash; Familiarity with real estate asset management, lease compliance (if applicable), and contributing to master plans for corporate-owned property portfolios.
	Strong Communication &mdash; Clear verbal/written skills for liaising with vendors, internal teams, tenants/employees, and leadership; includes conflict resolution, feedback delivery, and relationship building.
	Organizational &amp; Time Management &mdash; Ability to multitask, prioritize urgent issues, coordinate multiple contractors across properties, and meet tight deadlines in fast-paced environments.
	Problem-Solving &amp; Analytical Abilities &mdash; Identifying issues, analyzing vendor performance data, mitigating risks, and making data-driven decisions to optimize costs and quality.
	Nationals of Members State of Africa Re.


Communication and Teamwork:


	Speaks and writes clearly and effectively, particularly in report writing and proposals
	Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audience.
	Fluency in one or the two official languages of the Corporation (French or English) is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in software/tools (e.g., Microsoft Office suite, Yardi, or property management platforms for tracking vendors/work orders).
	Ability to work independently, handle stress, and adapt in dynamic corporate environments.
	Works collaboratively with Colleagues to achieve Organizational goals
	Establishes and maintains effective work relationships in a multicultural and multi-ethnic environment.


Salary and Benefits
The successful candidate shall have the following benefits:


	Competitive basic salary on the Corporation&rsquo;s senior staff (SS) grade level
	Inflation adjustment that may vary, depending on the prevailing economic situation
	Variable pay (annual performance bonus)
	Joint contribution to the Provident Fund (7% of the basic salary paid by staff and 14% paid by the employer)
	Education subsidy for each child up to 26 years (maximum of 4 children)
	Medical cover for staff and recognized dependents
	Transportation allowance
	Housing allowance.


Note


	Africa Re is an equal-opportunity employer and offers a good working environment commensurate with comparable international organizations.
	The Corporation reserves the right to appoint at the advertised grade level or at any other level that may suit the profile, qualifications, and experience of the successful candidate.

Warehouse Transport Executive Job at Blume Distribution Limited




        
    

        
        Blume Distribution Limited plays a crucial role in promoting and distributing the wide range of products manufactured by Sonia Foods Industries Limited. With a strong presence in the Nigerian market, Sonia Foods Industries Limited has established itself as a trusted and renowned brand known for its high-quality tomato-based food and beverages.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Transport Executive
Job Location: Sagamu Ogun.
Employment Type: Full-time.

Job Summary
     

            
    




	This role oversees vehicles, drivers, and goods in transit, ensuring a seamless supply of vehicles for loading and delivery while maintaining compliance with company policies and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and manage daily transport operations for distribution activities.
	Ensure timely supply of vehicles for loading and delivery based on dispatch schedules.
	Monitor goods in transit to ensure on-time and intact delivery to distributors and customers.
	Track vehicle movements, fuel usage, and delivery timelines.
	Coordinate with warehouse, sales, and logistics teams to align transport needs with delivery plans.
	Handle transport-related issues such as delays, breakdowns, accidents, or delivery discrepancies.
	Maintain accurate records of deliveries, trip sheets, fuel consumption, and transport costs.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards, traffic laws, and company transport policies.
	Support cost control initiatives by optimizing routes and vehicle utilization.


Qualifications & Experience


	Minimum of OND/HND/BSc in logistics, transport management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2–5 years of experience in transport or logistics operations, preferably in an FMCG or distribution company.
	Good understanding of fleet management and goods distribution processes.


Skills & Competencies


	Strong organizational and coordination skills.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple deliveries simultaneously.
	Basic knowledge of route planning and cost control.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic reporting.
	Problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Salary

N200,000-N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@blumedistribution.com CC: oluchi.sunday@blumedistribution.com Using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
